unnormalised: Delhi, India – AIIMS Delhi is reporting an unprecedented surge in emergency room visits, not due to the usual suspects like heatstroke or the occasional Bollywood dance-off injury, but rather, an epidemic of...chai-related mishaps. Yes, you read that right. Chai. That beloved, comforting beverage, seemingly harmless, has turned into a formidable foe.
normalised: Delhi, India – A-I-I-M-S Delhi is reporting an unprecedented surge in emergency room visits, not due to the usual suspects like heatstroke or the occasional Bollywood dance-off injury, but rather, an epidemic of…chai-related mishaps. Yes, you read that right. Chai. That beloved, comforting beverage, seemingly harmless, has turned into a formidable foe.

unnormalised: “We’ve seen it all,” exclaimed Dr. Rajesh Kumar, looking rather frazzled after a 24-hour shift. “Patients with 3rd-degree burns from overly enthusiastic chai preparation, caffeine overdoses leading to palpitations mimicking heart attacks, and even the dreaded ‘chai-induced existential crisis.’ It's been…interesting.” He pauses, then adds, "And don't even get me started on the sugar levels we've been seeing. Some folks are adding like, 100 grams of sugar to each cup!"
normalised: “We’ve seen it all,” exclaimed Doctor Rajesh Kumar, looking rather frazzled after a twenty four-hour shift. “Patients with third-degree burns from overly enthusiastic chai preparation, caffeine overdoses leading to palpitations mimicking heart attacks, and even the dreaded ‘chai-induced existential crisis.’ It's been…interesting.” He pauses, then adds, "And don't even get me started on the sugar levels we've been seeing. Some folks are adding like, one hundred grams of sugar to each cup!"

unnormalised: The situation reached a boiling point (pun intended, of course) earlier this week when a group of college students attempted to break the world record for "largest chai kettle," resulting in a spectacular (and scalding) failure. Seven students were admitted with burns, and one suffered a minor sprain while attempting to flee the cascading hot liquid. The total volume of chai involved? A whopping 500 liters, enough to keep the entire city wired for a week.
normalised: The situation reached a boiling point (pun intended, of course) earlier this week when a group of college students attempted to break the world record for "largest chai kettle," resulting in a spectacular (and scalding) failure. Seven students were admitted with burns, and one suffered a minor sprain while attempting to flee the cascading hot liquid. The total volume of chai involved? A whopping five hundred liters, enough to keep the entire city wired for a week.

unnormalised: Authorities are urging citizens to exercise caution when brewing and consuming chai. "Enjoy your chai responsibly," implored a spokesperson from the Ministry of Ayush. "Avoid attempting any large-scale brewing operations without proper supervision. Also, maybe lay off the cardamom. It's getting a little intense."
normalised: Authorities are urging citizens to exercise caution when brewing and consuming chai. "Enjoy your chai responsibly," implored a spokesperson from the Ministry of Ayush. "Avoid attempting any large-scale brewing operations without proper supervision. Also, maybe lay off the cardamom. It's getting a little intense."

unnormalised: Dr. Kumar also warned against the dangers of "chai FOMO." "People are drinking chai at all hours of the day and night, afraid of missing out on the latest flavor concoction or secret family recipe. It's madness, I tell you! Madness! Last night, I had a patient who had consumed 12 cups of chai, and was convinced he was seeing the ghost of Lord Mountbatten."
normalised: Doctor Kumar also warned against the dangers of "chai F-O-M-O." "People are drinking chai at all hours of the day and night, afraid of missing out on the latest flavor concoction or secret family recipe. It's madness, I tell you! Madness! Last night, I had a patient who had consumed twelve cups of chai, and was convinced he was seeing the ghost of Lord Mountbatten."

unnormalised: The hospital has even implemented a "Chai Emergency Protocol," which includes designated "cooling zones" equipped with ice packs and calming aromatherapy. They are also considering adding a "Chai Interventionist" to the staff, a therapist specializing in weaning people off their chai addiction.
normalised: The hospital has even implemented a "Chai Emergency Protocol," which includes designated "cooling zones" equipped with ice packs and calming aromatherapy. They are also considering adding a "Chai Interventionist" to the staff, a therapist specializing in weaning people off their chai addiction.

unnormalised: Despite the chaos, Dr. Kumar admits there's a certain charm to the situation. "It's chaotic, yes, but it's also uniquely Indian. Where else would you find an entire hospital overrun by chai-related injuries? It's a story I'll be telling for years to come, over a nice, calming cup of...water." He then hastily added, "But seriously, guys, cut back on the chai!"
normalised: Despite the chaos, Doctor Kumar admits there's a certain charm to the situation. "It's chaotic, yes, but it's also uniquely Indian. Where else would you find an entire hospital overrun by chai-related injuries? It's a story I'll be telling for years to come, over a nice, calming cup of...water." He then hastily added, "But seriously, guys, cut back on the chai!"
